content: in stockinette stitch = 10cm x10 cm needles circular needles 5 mm 60-100 cm 4 mm 60-100 cm 3 5 mm 40-100 cm double pointed needles 5mm 4mm yarn approximately 950 1050 1100 1200 1300 1400 metres of yarn that fits the gauge the tested yarn is hjelholdt håndværksgarn 500 600 600 600 700 700 gram was used when tested *small guide alternatives could for instance be peruvian highland wool from filcolana 100 m pr 50 g or one strand of silk mohair 212 m pr 25 g knitted with one strand of tweed 200 m pr 50 g both from isager or knitting for olive s heavy merino 125 m pr 50 g if one chooses for instance knitting for olive s heavy merino in a size 2 the yarn runs 125 m pr 50 grams and one needs 1050 m that means 1050 m / 125 m = 8 4 = 9 balls of heavy merino for the isager yarn in size 2 it would be tweed 1050 m / 200 m = 5 25 = 6 balls of yarnplus silk mohair 1050 / 212 = 4 9 = 5 balls of yarn so size metres of yarn / the chosen yarn meterage per ball = x balls of yarn *
